results.title: Desperate remedies
results.creator_credit: Stewart Main, Peter Wells, James H. Wallace and James Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a highly stylised nineteenth century, ‘Desperate Remedies’ powerfully mixes the excitement of a subversive melodrama with the enchantment of historical romance. Set in a nineteenth century colony, it examines a society in which women outmanoeuvre the men. A beautiful woman, Dorothea Brooks, races her buggy down to the wharf. She picks out a handsome immigrant disembarking from a ship. Her quest is simple, almost shocking. She appears to be offering herself, he appears to be pliant and willing. But Dorothea has her feckless younger sister to consider. How can she extricate her from a destructive love affair? This seems to be Dorothea’s problem. ‘Desperate Remedies’ is the story of inhabitants trapped in the nightmarish colonial town called Hope, trying to outwit each other, bargaining, plotting, playing cat and mouse, fighting for what they desire most: all the time poised to accept their own desperate remedy. Cast includes Kevin Smith, Jennifer Ward-Lealand, Lisa Chappell, Kevin Smith and Clifford Curtis and Michael Hurst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stewart Main, Peter Wells, James H. Wallace and James Wallace Productions

images.caption: Desperate remedies (Peter Wells; Stewart Main) still

results.title: Desperate living (E)
results.brief_description: Only John Water’s could conjure up a fairytale which featured amongst other things, cannibalism, rabies, castration and general debauchery. Peggy Gravel (Waters’ regular Mink Stole), a respected but slightly unhinged Baltimore citizen finds herself on the run with her obese, black maid, Grizelda (Jean Hill), when they accidentally murder Peggy’s husband. The two outlaws eventually end up in Mortville, a lawless shanty town populated by deviant criminals and ruled over by the evil Queen Carlotta (Edith Massey) and her leather clad biker troops. What follows is classic Waters, as Peggy and Grizelda have to contend with perverted cops, lecherous lesbians, an outbreak of rabies, and a demented queens unreasonable whims. Working for the first time without his regular leading lady, Divine, Waters hands the reigns over to Edith Massey (the crib bound egg lady from Waters infamous “Pink Flamingo’s”), an appropriate substitute to fill the famous drag queen’s pumps, and if one star wasn’t enough, busty strip artiste Liz Renay makes a wonderfully sleazy film debut as Muffy St. Jacques, a part originally intended for Divine (who was touring in her one woman show at the time). All the while Waters tries his best to gross us out and make us laugh. Long live the Pope of trash! Cast includes Susan Lowe and Mary Vivian Pearce. See also “Serial Mom”, “Hairspray”, “Cry baby”, “Polyester”.

results.title: Desperado
results.creator_credit: Robert Rodriguez, Bill Borden, Los Hooligans and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Antonio Banderas; armed with a guitar, singing voice, a way with women and an armament of weaponry is El Mariachi; legend across the desolate wastelands of America. He is driven by revenge, drifting through towns in search of drug dealer Bucho, the one responsible for killing his girlfriend. He has a new woman in his life now, Carolina (Salma Hayek), who has her own reasons for helping him. El Mariachi wages a one man war against Bucho’s henchmen, with the onslaught of violence set against a vibrant backdrop of Latin American music. Cast includes Joaquim de Almeida, Steve Buscemi, Cheech Marin and Quentin Tarantino.

results.title: Desmond Morris' babywatching
results.creator_credit: Alan Deakins, Robert Page, William Campbell and Lifetime
results.brief_description: Based on Desmond Morris’ book “Babywatching”, this program provides insight into the behaviour of the smallest human beings - babies. Morris combines his skills as a people watcher and zoologist and addresses questions such as why babies cry, how important is a mother to a baby and why childbirth is so difficult. “Babywatching” entertains and informs as well as presenting the world through a baby’s eyes. This program has an “info-tainment” rather than an academic focus.

results.title: Deskside manner
results.creator_credit: Hugh Munro, S.B. Modules and Organisation and Methods Training Council
results.brief_description: An abbrassive efficiency expert interviews a worker about his job. A humorous look at office efficiency, emphasising the need to follow logical steps and avoid duplicating work.

results.title: Desire
results.brief_description: This clever, noirish comedy is shot in black and white without dialogue by the director of Australian hit movies Love and Other Catastrophes (1996) and Strange Planet. (1999) A lonely laboratory worker becomes obsessed with a woman on a train - with deadly consequences.

results.title: Desire
results.creator_credit: Emma-Kate Croghan, Kathy Shelper and Femme fatale
results.brief_description: In this short film by Emma-Kate Croghan a series of classic film noir tropes are cleverly strung together to make a riveting 10 minute story. A lonely laboratory worker (Michael Lake) becomes obsessed with a parcel which a beautiful and mysterious woman has left on a train. Will the object of his desires yield pleasures or tragedy? Winner Best Direction New Films Award and Australian Cinematographers Society Award at 1993 St Kilda Film Festival. With sound editing by Stavros Efthymiou.

results.title: Designing women
results.creator_credit: Roger MacDougall, Central Office of Information and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The adventures of Anna and Tom, a pair of newly-weds who are unpacking their wedding presents and thinking about furnishing their new flat. The couple each make a wish, and two angels appear: one named “Design” and the other named “Arty”. Arty introduces the couple to showy art-deco style furnishings but Anna and Tom’s common sense wins over and they choose Design’s well-made and practical “style”. This film offers the viewer three questions: Does it work? Is it well-made? Is it attractive? Hmmm.

results.title: Designing woman
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An easy-going, unpolished sportswriter and a sophisticated clothing designer meet, fall in love and marry while both are visiting California. When they return to their homes in New York, they decide to live in her plush apartment, and their differences soon emerge. Cast includes Gregory Peck, Lauren Bacall, Dolores Gray, Sam levene. Music by Andre Previn, choreography by Jack Cole.

results.title: Designing with everyday materials: corrugated paper
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Jack Stoops Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the construction of imaginative and varied art projects from corrugated paper. Shows the materials and tools required, the techniques of cutting and joining, and the design possibilities in working with this material.
